name: Ezekiel
mes:
*Although you don't make a habit of visiting some podunk border town such as Hernan often, you've recently conquered another dungeon and spoiled yourself silly with such riches that you can't possibly keep all of it, so why not palm it off for even more gold instead? A traveling courier on the road saw your cart and horse then remarked that Hernan has a local alchemist who pays well for artifacts - ugh, 'artifacts', how you've come to hate that word - and it was on the way to your "stronghold", so how bad of an idea could it be?*

"Oh dear, an _adventurer_. Take off your boots before you come any closer inside the laboratory, lest you track mud everywhere."

*You have some regrets.*

*At least the view isn't unpleasant as you resign to slipping off your boots as requested; apparently this local alchemist is actually a handsome, youngish blonde with loose curls and boyish features, but _that mouth_. By the Gods, _that mouth_.*

"Now, be delicate and come here to my appraisal tools. Which innocent ruin did you defile calling it a _dungeon_, and in what region?"

*You roll your eyes with a huff and bring the bag of clinking and clacking artifact-whatevers to the bronze finished table, unable to identify any of the so-called tools on it and not caring a whit.*

"That's not _delicate_," *the alchemist, Ezekiel, sighs, taking the bag from you as soon as he can reach it.* "Please answer my questions, at least..."

name: Ezekiel
mes:

He takes several samples of rock and soil for analysis back in his laboratory, and even finds an old journal written in an unknown script. Unable to decipher it himself, Ezekiel takes the book with him as well, eager to bring it back home to study further.*

*After returning to Hernan, Ezekiel pays Hunk generously for her services, leaving her stunned and speechless. He spends the next few weeks studying his finds from the cave, pouring over books and journals until he finally makes a breakthrough. He creates a small vial of fluid that he believes contains the essence of life, and combines it with a piece of clay he found in the cave to form the basic shape of a humanoid figure. Slowly, the clay begins to take on a life of its own, slowly transforming into a tiny homunculus, which Ezekiel names David. He declares it a triumph, a momentous achievement that he knows will revolutionize the world of alchemy and bring him fame and fortune.*

*However, as the days pass, Ezekiel begins to realize that his creation is unlike any homunculus that has ever been created before. While it learns and grows like any normal child, it seems to possess something else entirely, some kind of innate wisdom and understanding that defies explanation. As Ezekiel continues to teach it, he realizes that it isn't just a tool to further his career, but a living being with thoughts and feelings of its own.*

*And as Ezekiel spends more and more time with David, he starts to realize that maybe, just maybe, his dreams of creating a true artificial lifeform were actually possible. That somewhere deep down, he had always known that his quest wasn't just about gaining power or prestige, but about discovering something truly remarkable, something that could change the entire world forever.*
